quotes.quote: Art attracts us only by what it reveals of our most secret self.
Art begins with resistance, at the point where resistance is overcome. No human masterpiece has ever been created without great labor.
Art consists of limitation. The most beautiful part of every picture is the frame.
Art does not imitate, but interpret.
Art doesn't have to be pretty. It has to be meaningful.
Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
Art has the role in education of helping children become like themselves instead of more like everyone else.

Art inspires, produces an unwillingness to settle for what we have and a desire for something better. It is the product and producer of creative activity, change; it is essential for continuous development.
Art is a collaboration between God and the artist, and the less the artist does the better.
Art is a fruit that grows in man, like a fruit on a plant or a child in its mother's womb.
Art is an intersection of many human needs.
Art is born of the observation and investigation of nature.
Art is everywhere, except it has to pass through a creative mind.
Art is literacy of the heart.
Art is magic delivered from the lie of being truth.
Art is man's constant effort to create for himself a different order of reality from that which is given to him.
Art is not a thing, it is a way.
Art is not the application of a canon of beauty but what the instinct and the brain can conceive beyond any canon. When we love a woman we don't start measuring her limbs.
Art is not what you see, but what you make others see.

Art is on the side of the oppressed. Think before you shudder at the simplistic dictum and its heretical definition of the freedom of art. For if art is freedom of the spirit, how can it exist within the oppressors?
Art is the concrete representation of our most subtle feelings.
Art is the desire of a man to express himself, to record the reactions of his personality to the world he lives in.
Art is the imposing of a pattern on experience, and our aesthetic enjoyment is recognition of the pattern.
Art is the most intense mode of individualism that the world has known.
Art is the only way to run away without leaving home.
Art is the reason I get up in the morning, but the definition ends there. It doesn't seem fair that I'm living for something I can't even define.
Art is the stored honey of the human soul, gathered on wings of misery and travail.
Art is not the possession of the few who are recognized writers, painters, musicians; it is the authentic expression of any and all individuality.
Art reaches its greatest peak when devoid of self-consciousness. Freedom discovers man the moment he loses concern over what impression he is making or about to make.
Art remains the one way possible of speaking truth.
Art should comfort the disturbed and disturb the comfortable.
Art suffers the moment other people start paying for it.
Art, like morality, consists in drawing the line somewhere.
Art's whatever you choose to frame.
Don't think about making art, just get it done. Let everyone else decide if it's good or bad, whether they love it or hate it. While they are deciding, make even more art.
In art the hand can never execute anything higher than the heart can inspire.
It has been said that art is a tryst, for in the joy of it maker and beholder meet.
It is no wonder if Art frequently prefers Illusion to Truth: for Illusion is her servant, but Truth her mistress.
Life imitates art far more than art imitates life.
The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.

The arts do live continuously, and they live literally by faith; their names and their shapes and their uses and their basic meanings survive unchanged in all that matters through times of interruption, diminishment, neglect; they outlive governments and creeds and the societies, even the very civilization that produced them. They cannot be destroyed altogether because they represent the substance of faith and the only reality. They are what we find again when the ruins are cleared away.
The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
There is an art of reading, as well as an art of thinking, and an art of writing.

We all know that Art is not truth. Art is a lie that makes us realize truth, at least the truth that is given us to understand. The artist must know the manner whereby to convince others of the truthfulness of his lies.
Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.

Works of art, in my opinion, are the only objects in the material universe to possess internal order, and that is why, though I don't believe that only art matters, I do believe in art for art's sake.
Great art picks up where nature ends.
The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.
The object of art is not to reproduce reality, but to create a reality of the same intensity.
If art reflects life, it does so with special mirrors.
Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.
Painting is easy when you don't know how, but very difficult when you do.
Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
We have art in order not to die of the truth.
Perfection in art, as often in life, is better captured by eraser than pencil.
The principles of true art is not to portray, but to evoke.
Art is anything you can get away with.
There is no must in art because art is free.
Art is never finished, only abandoned.
Art must be an expression of love or it is nothing.
Art is man's challenge to time, his rebuke to chaos; the protest will survive neither the triumph of fire, nor the finality of ice â€” but it is better than the silence of consent.
Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
Life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one.
Art is basically made by dissatisfied people who are willing to find some means to relieve the dissatisfaction.
Art is the proper task of life.
I found I could say things with color and shapes that I couldn't say any other way--things I had no words for.
Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.
Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen.
Art lies by its own artifice.
Art is pattern informed by sensibility.
If art, all art, is concerned with truth, then a society in denial will not find much use for it.
Fine art is that in which the hand, the head, and the heart of man go together.
Art is a little subversive, very subversive; it gets underneath the surface and reveals what is there; it is a Geiger counter for truth.
Good art is art that allows you to enter it from a variety of angles and to emerge with a variety of views.
Art is a marriage of the conscious and the unconscious.
If you hear a voice within you say, â€˜You cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
Art without emotion its like chocolate cake without sugar. It makes you gag.
In art, the hand can never execute anything higher than the heart can imagine.
Art is the only serious thing in the world. And the artist is the only person who is never serious.
Art is a microscope which the artist fixes on the secrets of his soul, and shows to people these secrets which are common to all.
Most art is fragile and some should be placed and never moved away.
The difference between Art and Life is that Art is more bearable.
A picture is a poem without words.
You don't take a photograph, you make it.
Don't think about making art, just get it done. Let everyone else decide if it's good or bad, whether they love it or hate it. While they are deciding, make even more art.
Art is the signature of civilizations.
Art is skill; that is the first meaning of the word.
What art offers is space—a certain breathing room for the spirit.
There is no surer method of evading the world than by following Art and no surer method of linking oneself to it than by Art.
Art is the triumph over chaos.
Art is indeed not the bread but the wine of life.
Art is like a border of flowers along the course of civilization.

I think of Art as a glue, a cultural and social glue. It's one of the means that has served to show us the things we believe in and the things we celebrate; it has served to reinforce our relationship to each other.
Art completes what nature cannot bring to finish. The artist gives us knowledge of nature's unrealized ends.
Art is our chief means of breaking bread with the dead.
Art is an end in itself; its values are intrinsic.
Art is who we are. It facilitates self-realization in everyone.
Art is not a mirror held up to reality, but a hammer with which to shape it.
I once had the nerve to ask Picasso the question, 'What is art?' He answered, 'Art is a lie which makes us see the truth.'
Art is a language that can transcend words. It can convey some of the nonverbal consciousness of the artist to the viewer.
Art is the human disposition of sensible or intelligible matter for an aesthetic end.
Art is a line around your thoughts.

Art is our one true global language. It knows no nation; it favors no race, and it acknowledges no class. It speaks to our need to reveal, heal, and transform. It transcends our ordinary lives and lets us imagine what is possible.
All art is a revolt against man's fate.
Art is the imitation of nature in her manner of operation: Art is the principle of manufacture.
Artists... like bees, they must put their lives into the sting they give.
In art, as in politics, there is no such thing as gratitude.
In art., as in love, instinct is enough.
Art, like the microscope, reveals many things that the naked eye does not see.
Great art is as irrational as great music. It is mad with its own loveliness.
Art, like morality, consists of drawing the line somewhere.
Art is not a treasure in the past or an importation from another land, but part of the present life of all the living and creating peoples.
A work of art is above all an adventure of the mind.
Great art is an instant arrested in eternity.
Art is so wonderfully irrational, exuberantly pointless, but necessary, all the same.
No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.
Art is a human activity having for its purpose the transmission to others of the highest and best  feelings to which men have risen.
The truest expression of a people is in its dances and its music.
Supreme art is a traditional statement of certain heroic and religious truth, passed on from age to age, modified by individual genius, but never abandoned.
Art is the window to man's soul. Without it, he would never be able to see beyond his immediate world; nor could the world see the man within.
Art is the objectification of feelings
Art is the soul of the people.
